content: use a stitch marker for seamless rounds magic loop or ch4 leave a longer tail to use as stuffing and join r1 sc8 in magic loop or ch4 loop pull closed and join /8st r2 single_crochet in each st /8st r3 single_crochet in each st /8st r4 single_crochet in each st /8st r5 single_crochet in each st /8st stuff the tail left at the beginning into the work cut your working yarn leaving a longer tail for sewing *eyes make two * worked in row each row ends with chain 1 and turn your work begin with chain 4 r1 single_crochet into second chain from hook single_crochet into next 2 st /3st r2 scinc into first st single_crochet into next st scinc into last st /5st r3 scinc into first st single_crochet into next 3 st scinc into last st ch1 and turn /7st r4 single_crochet into each st /7st r5 single_crochet into each st /7st r6 single_crochet into each st /7st r7 single_crochet into each st /7st r8 scdec first 2 st single_crochet into next 3st scdec into last st /5st r9 scdec first 2 st single_crochet into next st scdec last 2 st 3st r10 scdec first 2 st single_crochet into next st /2st r11 scdec both st /1st r12 single_crochet 1 /1st turn your work and begin to crochet along the side of the eye increase your gauge a bit for a smoother finish work a slip_stitch into the side of your last single_crochet then continue to single_crochet along the entire edge place about 1 single_crochet per row that you worked and 1 single_crochet per chain at the bottom edge when arriving back at the tip place another slip_stitch into the side of the last single_crochet from r12 cut the yarn leaving a long tail for sewing **sewing** if you worked the body with joined rounds make sure the seam is in the back sew the eyes to the body with the top edge sitting at about r10 of the head sew the arms at r23 and the legs at r30 sew in all remaining tails **done <3** if you have questions about this pattern suggestions for improvement or issues with accessibility please contact me on ravelry
